bio.name: Rachel Teo Si Yan
bio.summary: A 2nd-year PhD student doing machine learning at the National University of Singapore.

work.name: DBS Bank
highlights: Contributed to the building of an acquisition model for Paylah! customers in the Consumer Banking Analytics department.
Used SAS and SQL to extract and create the variables discussed from the DBS database.

work.name: Axis Capital
highlights: Worked full-time under the Catastrophe Modelling (CAT) team in re-insurance.
Ran Catastrophe models and performed preliminary analytical reports using industry-specific software.
Used various internal tools to assist the pricing process within the CAT team.
Created tools and scripts with Python to ease the process of data extraction for use in the model and analysis.

work.name: Murata Electronics Singapore
highlights: Performed data analysis for the cost management of the manufacturing of ceramic capacitors.
Innovated new methods to understand the cost structure and effectively manage profit/loss statements.
Presented and explained to management the linkage of profit/loss statements to production operations.
Improved efficiency and productivity of analysis through programming.

work.name: SINAPSE
highlights: Used Principle Component Analysis (PCA) and Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) in Matlab to reduce dimensions of large datasets and perform classification analysis.
Datasets consisted of spike trains of neurons in monkeys' brains that were recorded as they performed a working memory task.
Simple classification analysis was used to understand the mechanism of neurons during the engagement of working memory.

education.area: Specialization in Mathematical Modeling and Data Analysis
